sen.j: 三浦 朗次（みうら あきつぐ、天保5年8月13日 (旧暦)（1834年9月15日） - 安政7年2月21日 (旧暦)（1860年3月13日））は、日本の江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Akitsugu MIURA (September 15, 1834 to March 13, 1860) was a feudal lord (daimyo) in Japan during the Edo period.
Akitsugu MIURA (September 15, 1834 to March 13, 1860) was a feudal lord (daimyo) in Japan during the Edo period.
Akitsugu MIURA (September 15, 1834 - March 13, 1860) was a feudal lord (daimyo) in Japan during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: toをハイフンに訂正しました。

sen.j: 美作勝山藩の第8代藩主。
sen.e: He was the 8th lord of the Katsuyama Domain in Mimasaka Province.
He was the 8th lord of the Katsuyama Domain in Mimasaka Province.
He was the 8th lord of the Katsuyama Domain in Mimasaka Province.

sen.j: 越前国丸岡藩主・有馬清純の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Arima Kiyosumi, the lord of the Maruoka Domain in Echizen Province.
He was the second son of Arima Kiyosumi, the lord of the Maruoka Domain in Echizen Province.
He was the second son of Kiyosumi ARIMA, the lord of the Maruoka Domain in Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: Kiyosumi ARIMA表記の訂正しました。

sen.e: His officially recognized wife was Masahiro MATSUDA's daughter.
sen.cmt: 松田勝敬の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His officially recognized wife was Masahiro MATSUDA's daughter.
His officially recognized wife was Katsutaka MATSUDA's daughter.
sen.cmt: 読み不明ですが、用語集よりKatsutaka MATSUDAと訂正しました。

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、志摩国守。
sen.e: He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Shima no kuni no kami (govenor of Shima Province).
sen.cmt: 志摩国守、訳抜け。補足しました。

sen.e: Akitsugu MIURA was born on September 15, 1834.
Akitsugu MIURA was born on September 15, 1834.
Akitsugu MIURA was born on September 15, 1834.
His childhood name was Gonosuke.
sen.cmt: 剛之助の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His childhood name was Gonosuke.
His childhood name was Gonosuke.
His first adulthood name was Junkaku.
sen.cmt: 純恪の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His first adulthood name was Junkaku.
His first adulthood name was Junkaku.

sen.j: 嘉永元年（1848年）11月22日、先代藩主の三浦義次 が隠居したため、その後を継いだ。
sen.e: He succeeded Yoshitsugu MIURA, the previous lord, as the lord of the Katsuyama Domain on November 22, 1848 (traditional Japanese calendar date) after Yoshitsugu's retirement.
He succeeded Yoshitsugu MIURA, the previous lord, as the lord of the Katsuyama Domain on November 22, 1848 (traditional Japanese calendar date) after Yoshitsugu's retirement.
He succeeded Yoshitsugu MIURA, the previous lord, as the lord of the Katsuyama Domain on December 17, 1848 after Yoshitsugu's retirement.

sen.j: 安政7年（1860年）2月21日、27歳で死去し、後を養嗣子の三浦弘次が継いだ。
sen.e: He died on February 21, 1860 (traditional Japanese calendar date) at the age of 27 and was succeeded by Hirotsugu MIURA, his adopted heir.
He died on February 21, 1860 (traditional Japanese calendar date) at the age of 27 and was succeeded by Hirotsugu MIURA, his adopted heir.
He died on March 13, 1860 at the age of 27 and was succeeded by Hirotsugu MIURA, his adopted heir.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Seikoin.
sen.cmt: 清広院の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Seikoin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Seikoin.

sen.j: 墓所：東京都府中市 (東京都)紅葉丘の誓願寺。
sen.e: His grave is in Seigan-ji Temple in Momijigaoka, Fuchu City, Tokyo Metropolitan Prefecture.
His grave is in Seigan-ji Temple in Momijigaoka, Fuchu City, Tokyo Metropolitan Prefecture.
His grave is in Seigan-ji Temple in Momijigaoka, Fuchu City, Tokyo Metropolitan Prefecture.
